item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 2, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Geothermal power is a climate moon shot beneath our feet (49 points | 39 comments)
2. Smallpond – A lightweight data processing framework built on DuckDB and 3FS (75 points | 36 comments)
3. Speedrunners are vulnerability researchers, they just don't know it yet (116 points | 42 comments)
4. The Pentium contains a complicated circuit to multiply by three (109 points | 14 comments)
5. Matt's Script Archive (1995) (18 points | 6 comments)
6. API design note: Beware of adding an "Other" enum value (41 points | 25 comments)
7. Turning my ESP32 into a DNS sinkhole to fight doomscrolling (16 points | 1 comment)
8. 2025 Hiring Pause (82 points | 40 comments)
9. Hallucinations in code are the least dangerous form of LLM mistakes (13 points | 6 comments)
10. Why do we have both CSRF protection and CORS? (54 points | 32 comments)
11. olduse.net (75 points | 10 comments)
12. Verifiable science on modified PCR machine (15 points | 2 comments)
13. Raspberry Pi Pico audio player (98 points | 19 comments)
14. Distro (YC S24) is hiring a marketing lead in Palo Alto ( | hide)
15. Gödel's theorem debunks the most important AI myth – Roger Penrose [video] (17 points | 19 comments)
16. I struggled with Git, so I'm making a game to spare others the pain (85 points | 93 comments)
17. Schools reviving shop class (21 points | 1 comment)
18. Google does not want rights to things you do using Chrome (2008) (103 points | 45 comments)
19. Show HN: Recommendarr – AI Driven Recommendations Based on Sonarr/Radarr Media (35 points | 15 comments)
20. When Professor Bryant Lin got cancer, he taught a class about it (58 points | 13 comments)
21. Effective Rust (2024) (103 points | 62 comments)
22. GPT-4.5: "Not a frontier model"? (129 points | 113 comments)
23. New battery-free technology can power devices using ambient RF signals (46 points | 22 comments)
24. Stone tool analysis in Southeast Asia provides evidence of seafaring technology (13 points | 3 comments)
25. Towards a test suite for TOTP codes (52 points | 11 comments)
26. An ode to TypeScript enums (47 points | 40 comments)
27. Show HN: SafeHaven – A Minimal VPN Implementation in Go (59 points | 7 comments)
28. Mucins keep the brain safe and could guard against ageing (149 points | 47 comments)
29. Show HN: I built a modern Goodreads alternative (202 points | 170 comments)
30. Executive wealth as a factor in return-to-office (460 points | 299 comments)
